properties.areaDesc: Sterling; Coleman; Callahan; Taylor; Nolan; Fisher; Coke; Haskell; Jones; Shackelford; Runnels; Throckmorton
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 4:33AM CST by NWS San Angelo TX
properties.description:
At 420 am, a band of light to moderate snow was moving through the
eastern Big Country, and the Texas Department of Transportation
reports interstate 20 is covered in snow near Abilene. Also, there
was a report of 3 inches of snow in Fort Phantom, and there have
been previous reports in Nolan, Jones and Haskell counties of
light snow accumulations. Go to drivetexas.org for the latest road
conditions and use caution if you are heading out on the road this
morning.

With brisk north to northwest winds, wind chill values will be in
the 15 to 20 degree range across most of the Big Country, and 20
to 25 degrees south into northern Sterling, Coke, Runnels and
Coleman Counties. Be sure to bundle up should you be out and about
this morning.

Conditions will quickly improve by late Saturday morning, when
clearing skies are expected with temperatures climbing into the
upper 30s to lower 40s across the area.

NWSheadline: MUCH COLDER WITH LIGHT WINTRY PRECIPITATION EARLY THIS MORNING
